instructions.title: SURFACE PREPARATION
instructions.data: Allow new concrete to dry for 14-28 days under normal weather conditions before painting. Surface to be painted should be clean and dry, free from oil, grease, dust, dirt, contaminants, and all loose grit and mortar. If neutralizing, treat surface with a solution of 1 part BOYSEN®® Masonry Neutralizer B‑44 diluted in 16 parts water, applying liberally by brush or roller. Let dry overnight before rinsing with water to remove white crystals that form on the surface. Let dry before painting. Note: If the concrete has been cured for more than 28 days, there is no need for neutralizer.

instructions.title: APPLICATION SCHEDULE
instructions.data:
Prime the entire concrete surface, whether previously painted or bare, with Marmorino Primer B‑5005.
Using the provided Marmorino Trowel, liberally apply a coat of prepared colored Marmorino Classico (Marmorino Classico mixed with the desired Marmorino Toner) onto the properly prepared surface.
Apply a second coat of the colored Marmorino Classico and keep ridges and trowel imperfections to a minimum. Allow this to dry overnight until wet spots are no longer visible.
Spot apply a third coat of colored Marmorino Classico to achieve the desired marble pattern. Allow setting for a few minutes only.
For polishing, press in some more Marmorino Classico using the trowel for surface leveling. This is to achieve a more uniform and smoother finish. Let dry for another 48 hours.
Once Marmorino has dried, use a soft sponge to apply the provided Natural Wax Protection, B‑5000. Work the wax into the surface and wipe any excess fluid off. Cover about 1 square meter at a time for better control over the design.
Finally, smooth over the surface using a soft, lint-free cloth.

instructions.title: NOTES
instructions.data:
To create a variety of shades, add a minimum of one to a maximum of seven 240-gram Marmorino toner for every 24-kg pail of Marmorino Classico.
Use only Marmorino Toners for Marmorino Classico.
